bibliographic-data.invention-title: COMPUTER-IMPLEMENTED METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR ADJUSTING THE COST BASIS OF A SECURITY

nplcit.text: Information on Tax Basis Allocations and Related Matters, found on the internet at http://www.hosthotels.com/dividendTax/tbachart3.pdf, October 11, 2007-referring to events in 1998-2000
Stock Split Does Become Math Exercise,The Hartford Courant, December 06, 1998 , By Matthew Lubanko

abstract.p: A computer-implemented method and apparatus for determining a cost basis associated with a plurality of shares of a security. In response to information identifying an issuer, the purchase date and the sale date, a list of capital events that occurred in connection with the security between the purchase date and the sale date is retrieved from a database. One or more shares held adjustment ratios are then retrieved from a database. Each of the shares held adjustment ratios corresponds to one of the capital events that occurred in connection with the security between the purchase date and the sale date. A current cost basis associated with the security may then be determined in accordance with the one or more cost adjustment ratios and the purchase price per share of the security.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Computer-implemented method and apparatus for adjusting the cost basis of a security

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR DETERMINING THE FINANCIAL STATUS OF BONDS

abstract.p: Systems and methods for determining the financial status of a bond according to various aspects of the present invention may comprise a graphical user interface, a database linked to the graphical user interface, a bond analysis engine linked to the database, and a display. The graphical user interface may be configured to receive information associated with the bond from the user. The database may be linked to the graphical user interface and configured to store information associated with the bond from the user and retrieve the information associated with the bond from a data repository. The bond analysis engine may be linked to the database and configured to calculate a cost basis. The display may be configured to present the cost basis to the user.
